title: Deployment of Magnetic Sector Secondary Ion Mass Spectrometry Technology on Focused Ion Beam Instruments: From the Initial Concept Idea to the Analytical Add-On System
content: Irradiating a sample with an energetic focused ion beam (FIB) (energy ranging from a few hundred eV to a few tens of keV) leads to the emission of various secondary species which can be used for imaging and/or analytical purposes [1]. Equipping FIB based instruments with various detection units for the different accessible signals gives the user access to very complementary techniques to perform advanced correlative studies on a vast variety of sample systems. Most commonly, secondary electron (SE) detection is used to perform high-resolution imaging with good topographic contrast, while the mass filtered detection of emitted secondary ions (SI) enables high-sensitivity chemical analysis of the sample in 2D and 3D.
